function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Laboratory simulations of aerosol dispersion in a fluid-filled channel may assist in modeling contagious disease spread in built environments.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Dispersion of infected aerosol caused by people movement delays the effectiveness of ventilation in controlling contagious diseases in built environments.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The dispersal of contagious aerosol in buildings may lead to significant airborne transmission of diseases due to people movement, affecting individuals in the built environment.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High risk of exposure to small aerosols due to the movement of people in buildings","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Residence time of small aerosols leading to prolonged exposure","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of people movement on the mixing and dispersal of small aerosols","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation leading to increased residence time of small aerosols","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Movement of people leading to increased dispersal of co2 tracer and aerosols","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Conflict between reducing airborne infection risk and maintaining thermal comfort and reducing energy consumption during colder periods.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Challenging to quantify occupants’ exposure to airborne virus particles, leading to difficulty in estimating the likelihood of airborne infection.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Most studies of airborne infection for covid-19 have generated risk estimates based on the wells-riley approach, which may not fully account for the complexity of dose-response models.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inhomogeneous mixing of outdoor and indoor air leading to unpredictable distribution of virus particles","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Complex indoor air flows due to temperature differences and heat production exacerbating viral distribution unpredictability","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unknown presence and location of infectious occupants within indoor spaces","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unintentional supply of outdoor air due to porous building materials or other pathways","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inaccurate measurement of ventilation rates leading to assumption of adequate outdoor air supply","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dependence on co2 data for inferring the risk of airborne infection","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainties in values for quanta generation rate and viral load","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of a novel disease with limited data and experience","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty in quanta generation rate for airborne infection.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inaccurate assessment of infection risk due to low activity levels and inappropriate quanta generation rate.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation rate leading to increased likelihood of airborne infection.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High risk of covid-19 transmission in offices with vocalizing individuals and light exercise.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of covid-19 transmission in public indoor spaces with varying ventilation and occupancy scenarios.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Poor ventilation leading to a high number of secondary infections before and after lockdown.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of infection in regularly attended indoor spaces due to prolonged exposure to pre/asymptomatic individuals.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Poor ventilation leading to increased s i value, potentially contributing to the spread of covid-19","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty in transmission and infection nature of covid-19, including potential for new, more transmissible variants","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty and variability in quanta generation rates impacting infection modeling and risk assessment","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased airborne infection risk due to uncontrolled natural ventilation and high co2 levels in office","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Seasonal variation in airborne infection risk due to changes in outdoor air supply","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Higher secondary infection numbers in classrooms","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased secondary infection numbers during colder winter months","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Less well ventilated buildings in winter","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ventilation systems that recirculate a proportion of indoor air can contribute to the spread of contagious diseases if not properly regulated.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient ventilation in indoor spaces leading to high co2 levels","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Design of school classrooms allowing co2 levels to reach 2000 ppm for brief periods","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased airborne infection risk due to excess co2 and occupancy","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Complex ventilation flows and air flow between spaces","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Variability of covid-19 airborne spread based on environmental conditions and activity level","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Airborne transmission of covid-19 in indoor environments","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limitations of increasing ventilation in winter","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Incomplete understanding of covid-19 transmission mechanisms","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Centralized recirculation systems not effective at filtering out viral material","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited supply of clean air in spaces due to filter effectiveness and flow rate","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential generation of ozone and harmful by-products from uv lamps","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ineffective air filtration in certain areas of the room due to airflow patterns and room size","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited effectiveness of air cleaners/filters","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transport of exhaled pathogens to other occupants with personalized ventilation","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transporting virus-laden droplets with ductless pv system","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"}]}
